page.title: 07Dale Park
page.content:
To the east of Grizedale lies the quiet and secluded valley of{Dale {Park.}This has steeply wooded sides and narrow grass fields in the bottom, which form a part of the Graythwaite Estate.
Dale Park Beck, where herons are frequently seen, winds its way to the south to join Grizedale Beck at Rusland Pool. In some places the road is so narrow that cars need to pull off in order to pass.
There are two settlements in this valley, at High Dale Park and Middle Dale Park. The former relies on a private water supply from springs in the woods; these sometimes give out in prolonged periods of dry weather in the summer.
